billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CORPORATIONS, AUTHORITIES AND COMMISSIONS

title: Allows public authority in a city with a population of over 1 million to cancel taxpayer-funded contract where contractor convicted of related crime
summary: Allows public authority in a city with a population of over 1 million to cancel taxpayer-funded contract where contractor is convicted of related crime.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          534

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KLEIN  -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Corporations,  Authorities
         and Commissions

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the public authorities law, in relation to review of
         taxpayer-funded contracts with public authorities in  a  city  with  a
         population of over one million

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Article 9 of the  public  authorities  law  is  amended  by
    2  adding a new title 13 to read as follows:
    3                                  TITLE 13
    4           TAXPAYER-FUNDED CONTRACTS WITH PUBLIC AUTHORITIES IN A
    5                 CITY WITH A POPULATION OF OVER ONE MILLION
    6  SECTION  2990.  GROUNDS  FOR CANCELLATION OF CONTRACT BY PUBLIC AUTHORI-
    7          TIES.
    8    S 2990. GROUNDS FOR CANCELLATION OF CONTRACT  BY  PUBLIC  AUTHORITIES.
    9  ANY  TAXPAYER-FUNDED  CONTRACT FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF GOODS, SERVICES OR
   10  CONSTRUCTION WITH AN AUTHORITY OR COMMISSION  CONTINUED  OR  CREATED  BY
   11  THIS  CHAPTER, WHOSE JURISDICTION IS LIMITED TO A CITY WITH A POPULATION
   12  OF OVER ONE MILLION SHALL BE REVIEWED BY THE COMPTROLLER OF  SUCH  CITY.
   13  IF  THE  COMPTROLLER  FINDS THAT THE CONTRACTOR WHO HAS BEEN AWARDED THE
   14  CONTRACT HAS BEEN CONVICTED OF A CRIME WITHIN FIVE YEARS OF THE AWARDING
   15  OF THE CONTRACT, DIRECTLY RELATED TO CONTRACT  PROCUREMENT  OR  PERFORM-
   16  ANCE,  INCLUDING  BUT  NOT LIMITED TO BID RIGGING, FRAUDULENT BILLING OR
   17  ACCOUNTING, PREVAILING WAGE VIOLATIONS AND OSHA VIOLATIONS, THE AUTHORI-
   18  TY OR COMMISSION MAY CANCEL OR TERMINATE SUCH CONTRACT WITHOUT INCURRING
   19  ANY PENALTY OR DAMAGES ON ACCOUNT OF SUCH CANCELLATION OR TERMINATION.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04421-01-1
